passage: During the American Civil War, Thomas Morris Chester braved the front lines as a war correspondent for the Philadelphia Press . Amplifying the voices and experiences of Black soldiers ______ blank of particular importance to Chester, who later became an activist and lawyer during the postwar Reconstruction period.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is subject-verb agreement. The singular verb "was" agrees in number with the singular subject "amplifying." Gerunds such as "amplifying" are always singular.
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect because the plural verb "were" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject "amplifying."
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because the plural verb "have been" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject "amplifying."
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because the plural verb "are" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject "amplifying."
